children.subject:
Thank you! Considering I really suffered for 16a, 16b would be disastrous for me. I'd better reconsider my summer schedule.

By the way, it sounds like I have to search for a chill 2-unit course to be eligible for a scholarship, though.

Thanks again.

I dont know about 188 but 16B is notoriously hard for a lot of CS-focused students which is the majority of the students here. If you're shaky in 16A or in circuits in general, 16B will definitely be a pain. Even on a normal schedule in the semester, homeworks vary between 8~10 hours (they cut down the homework slightly this semester) and but some homework can take 12-14 hours. Some of my friend who have straight A's in 61 series, 70, 170 all either struggle and do bad in 16B or just do well but say its the hardest class they've ever taken in terms of the sheer number of hours spent into the class to do well. 

Don't forget you also have lab. The car in general is a pain to debug and sometimes you'll need to come for lab makeup sessions in order to finish the week's lab. 

I'd recommend just taking either 188 or 16B and just take it slow, focus on learning the material and have a more relaxed summer.

history.content:
My question is simple.

1) Although I know that it varies from person to person, does it sound doable for a general person?

(CS188 will be my first upper-div CS if I take)

2) How much workload should I expect?

P.S. If it sounds too hard, which course would you recommend for the 2-unit (Summer Session)?

Thank you in advance!
history.subject: Taking EE16b and CS188 in this summer
